docs.lead_paragraph: Compounding pharmacies, now facing their biggest regulatory threat, have staved off tougher federal oversight with the help of allies in Congress.

headline.seo: Drug Compounders Get Help on Capitol Hill
headline.main: Friends in Congress Have Helped Drug Compounders Avoid Tighter Rules
headline.print_headline: Friends in Congress Have Helped Drug Compounders Avoid Tighter Rules

docs.abstract: Drug compounders at center of deadly meningitis outbreak have staved off tougher federal oversight for more than two decades with help of powerful allies in Congress; niche industry is facing new regulatory threat as it confronts questions at Congressional hearings over the deadly outbreak.
docs.snippet: Compounding pharmacies, now facing their biggest regulatory threat, have staved off tougher federal oversight with the help of allies in Congress.

byline.original: By ERIC LICHTBLAU and SABRINA TAVERNISE

docs.abstract: Patients with late-stage lung and colon cancer often don't realize that chemotherapy will not cure them, a new study finds.
docs.snippet: Patients with late-stage lung and colon cancer often don't realize that chemotherapy will not cure them, a new study finds.

docs.lead_paragraph: Voters in two states approved making marijuana possession legal, but the states may now be on a collision course with the federal government.

headline.seo: Marijuana Laws Eased in Colorado and Washington
headline.main: Voters Ease Marijuana Laws in 2 States, but Legal Questions Remain
headline.print_headline: Voters Ease Marijuana Laws in 2 States, but Legal Questions Remain

docs.abstract: Voters in Colorado and Washington endorse legalization of recreational marijuana use in historic vote that draws comparisons to end of Prohibition; states, however, may clash with federal government, which still views marijuana as Schedule I prohibited substance.
docs.snippet: Voters in two states approved making marijuana possession legal, but the states may now be on a collision course with the federal government.
